    8585== Exams, Assignments, and Grading ==
    8686=== Grading Critera ===
    87 Homework: 40% [[BR]] Quizzes: 3% [[BR]] Midterm 1: 19% [[BR]] Midterm 2: 19% [[BR]] Endterm: 19% [[BR]]
     87Homework: 40% [[BR]] Participation: 5% [[BR]] Midterm 1: 18% [[BR]] Midterm 2: 18% [[BR]] Endterm: 19% [[BR]]
    8888
    89 === Homework and Quizzes ===
    90 Homework assignments must be turned in by the assigned due dates/times. Details of how to turn in a given assignment will be included in each assignment's handout. The 40% of your grade attributed to homework will be based on your ''top 7 out of 8'' homework scores. (You can spend the 8th one however you like, but if you decide to skip an assignment, do keep in mind that the material will still be on the exam and that the homework is intended to be a useful study/practice tool.) There will also be short weekly quizzes in the discussion sections to give you further practice with the course material; those will count relatively little towards your final grade (they're essentially a discussion section participation score), and they're just there for your benefit (to give you another chance to check your understanding of things and see what questions you might want to ask the TA).
     89=== Homework and Participation ===
     90Homework assignments must be turned in by the assigned due dates/times. Details of how to turn in a given assignment will be included in each assignment's handout. The 40% of your grade attributed to homework will be based on your ''top 7 out of 8'' homework scores. (You can spend the 8th one however you like, but if you decide to skip an assignment, do keep in mind that the material will still be on the exam and that the homework is intended to be a useful study/practice tool.) There will also be short weekly quizzes in the discussion sections to give you further practice with the course material; those will count relatively little towards your final grade (they will contribute to your participation score), and they're just there for your benefit (to give you another chance to check your understanding of things and see what questions you might want to ask the TA).
    9191
    9292=== Grade Change Policy ===
    … …  
    115115----
    116116== Discussion Forums for All Things CS122A ==
    117 We will be using Piazza for online class discussions. The system is catered to getting you the help you need fast and efficiently from classmates, the TAs, the Reader, and the Instructor. Rather than emailing your course or HW content questions to the teaching staff, you will be expected to post your questions on Piazza. (If you have any problems or feedback for the Piazza developers, email team@piazza.com.)  We've used Piazza for this class multiple times before, and it seems to work remarkably well. You can find our class Piazza page at: [http://piazza.com/uci/winter2017/cs122a].
     117We will be using Piazza (heavily!) for online class discussions. The system is catered to getting you the help you need fast and efficiently from classmates, the TAs, the Reader, and the Instructor. Rather than emailing your course or HW content questions to the teaching staff, you will be expected to post your questions on Piazza. (If you have any problems or feedback for the Piazza developers, email team@piazza.com.)  We've used Piazza for this class multiple times before, and it seems to work remarkably well. You can find our class Piazza page at: [http://piazza.com/uci/winter2017/cs122a]. With 400 students enrolled the course this term, Piazza is essentially our only hope for managing the class and getting everyone's questions answered -- office hours become hopeless/worthless at this scale, unfortunately. Your Piazza activity can also play into your 5% participation score -- in particular, misbehavior on Piazza could lead to loss of points.
    118118
    119 As you are aware, there is also a weekly Discussion session meeting, and attendance of those is highly encouraged. The encouragement will be provided via the quiz portion of your final grade (3%), as quizzes can only be taken in person during the Discussion session.  If for some reason you have to miss your session during one week, you can attend a different one if you want - but please try to avoid that, for load-balancing reasons, most weeks. You will be held responsible for the material discussed in the Discussion sessions, so if you opt out or miss one, be sure to ask a trusted classmate who's been to theirs what you might need to know. The Discussion sessions will also serve as "group office hours" - we will leave ample time for questions most weeks, so come armed with things you'd like to have clarified or expanded on. Lastly, in weeks where Monday is a UCI holiday, Wednesday Discussion session enrollees will also get the evening off. :-) (That will happen twice, during the weeks of Jan. 16/18 and Feb. 20/22.)
     119When using Piazza, there are a couple of things to keep in mind. Firstly, despite an unfortunate national trend towards the acceptance of nastiness in social media, hurtful Piazza behavior will not be tolerated -- try to be kind to your classmates. Secondly, Piazza is a wonderful resource for asking and answering questions -- as long as it is used thoughtfully. Please avoid re-asking questions that have already been asked and answered -- you are responsible for reading others' questions and not re-asking them. With 400+ eyes on each message, lazy question-asking on Piazza is costly and inconsiderate, and such behavior can lead to loss of participation points. Finally, Piazza is not a place to compare answers on HW problems -- it is not a place to either post, request, or compare answers to HW problems! (Doing so would actually risk violating the Academic Honesty Policy since everyone is expected to ultimately do their own work.)
     120
     121As you are aware, there is also a weekly Discussion session meeting, and attendance of those is highly encouraged. The encouragement will be provided via the participation portion of your final grade (5%), as quizzes can only be taken in person during the Discussion session.  If for some reason you have to miss your session during one week, you can request special permission to attend a different one - but please try to avoid that, for load-balancing reasons. You will be held responsible for the material discussed in the Discussion sessions, so if you opt out or miss one, be sure to ask a trusted classmate who's been to theirs what you might need to know. The Discussion sessions will also serve importantly as "group office hours" - we will leave ample time for questions most weeks, so come armed with things you'd like to have clarified or expanded on.
